experience_requirements: 4+ years hands-on experience developing and deploying computer vision models in real-world applications
Experience in cosmetic or defect grading applications (manufacturing, logistics, or visual inspection) is strongly preferred
Experience designing end-to-end CV systems including data pipelines and model training
Experience working with multidisciplinary teams (software, hardware, QA)
key_responsibilities: Design, train, and deploy deep learning models for fine-grained visual inspection and defect detection
Apply image analysis techniques (segmentation, feature extraction, contrast enhancement) to improve defect visibility
Build cosmetic grading models to classify surface conditions according to standards
Address label noise and uncertainty using techniques like label smoothing or human-in-the-loop feedback
Architect and manage image data pipelines from acquisition to annotation and model training
Collaborate with software engineers, QA teams, and hardware support to integrate models into production workflows
nice_to_have: Experience with AWS or other cloud platforms
Hands-on experience with production-grade CV systems and MLOps
Edge computing, real-time dashboards, and IoT integration
key_projects: SABIA-Mar satellite mission CV processing and data pipeline
Real-time license plate detection (YOLOv8, DeepSORT, OCR)
End-to-end computer vision production-control system for industrial plant
career_growth: Opportunity to lead computer vision initiatives
Build expertise in cosmetic/defect grading domains
Scale CV systems to production with cloud and edge deployment
special_instructions: Assess candidate fit using the JobRequirements model; highlight strengths and gaps with explicit scoring details.

strengths: End-to-end data pipelines and production workflow experience
Experience with real-world production CV systems in high-stakes environments
gaps: Explicit cosmetic industry domain knowledge and standards

score_explanation: Technical skills: Candidate demonstrates strong Python, PyTorch/TF, CV techniques, and data pipelines; AWS + edge/production deployment show alignment with job requirements.
Domain: Candidate lacks direct cosmetic/defect grading domain experience, representing a gap that could be mitigated by transferable CV/industrial inspection experience.
Experience: Candidate has 5+ years in CV-related roles including leadership, with hands-on deployment and end-to-end systems; aligns well with senior-level expectations.
Education: Candidate has relevant STEM degree and advanced ML coursework; exact matching to required field is not specified in job posting, treated as partial.
Industry knowledge: Limited in cosmetics/defect grading; strong general CV/industrial experience but industry alignment is not ideal.
